template.name: HPE MSA 2040 Storage by HTTP
template.description:
The template to monitor HPE MSA 2040 by HTTP. It works without any external scripts and uses the script item.
Setup: 1. Create user "zabbix" with monitor role on the storage. 2. Link the template to a host. 3. Configure {$HPE.MSA.API.PASSWORD} and an interface with address through which API is accessible. 4. Change {$HPE.MSA.API.SCHEME} and {$HPE.MSA.API.PORT} macros if needed.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: HPE MSA: Get data
item.description: The JSON with result of API requests.

item.name: Get method errors
item.description: A list of method errors from API requests.

trigger.name: There are errors in method requests to API
trigger.description: There are errors in method requests to API.

item.name: System contact
item.description: The name of the person who administers the system.

trigger.description: System health is in degraded state.

trigger.description: System health is in fault state.

trigger.name: System health is in unknown state
trigger.description: System health is in unknown state.

item.name: System information
item.description: A brief description of what the system is used for or how it is configured.

item.name: System name
item.description: The name of the storage system.

item.name: HPE MSA: Service ping
item.description: Check if HTTP/HTTPS service accepts TCP connections.

trigger.name: Service is down or unavailable
trigger.description: HTTP/HTTPS service is down or unable to establish TCP connection.

item_prototype.name: Controller [{#CONTROLLER.ID}]: Cache: Read hits, rate
item_prototype.description: For the controller that owns the volume, the number of times the block to be read is found in cache per second.

item_prototype.description: For the controller that owns the volume, the number of times the block to be read is not found in cache per second.

item_prototype.description: For the controller that owns the volume, the number of times the block written to is found in cache per second.

item_prototype.name: Controller [{#CONTROLLER.ID}]: Cache: Write misses, rate
item_prototype.description: For the controller that owns the volume, the number of times the block written to is not found in cache per second.

item_prototype.description: Percentage of write cache in use, from 0 to 100.

item_prototype.description: Controller cache memory size.

item_prototype.name: Controller [{#CONTROLLER.ID}]: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: Percentage of time the CPU is busy, from 0 to 100.

trigger_prototype.name: Controller [{#CONTROLLER.ID}]: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: Controller CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.description: The data read rate, in bytes per second.

item_prototype.name: Controller [{#CONTROLLER.ID}]: Data transfer rate: Total
item_prototype.description: The data transfer rate, in bytes per second, calculated over the interval since these statistics were last requested or reset. This value will be zero if it has not been requested or reset since a controller restart.

item_prototype.description: The data write rate, in bytes per second.

item_prototype.description: Number of read operations per second.

item_prototype.name: Controller [{#CONTROLLER.ID}]: IOPS, total rate
item_prototype.description: Input/output operations per second, calculated over the interval since these statistics were last requested or reset. This value will be zero if it has not been requested or reset since a controller restart.

item_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Status
item_prototype.description:
The status of the disk group:
- CRIT: Critical. The disk group is online but isn't fault tolerant because some of it's disks are down. - DMGD: Damaged. The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are damaged. - FTDN: Fault tolerant with a down disk.The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are down. - FTOL: Fault tolerant. - MSNG: Missing. The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are missing. - OFFL: Offline. Either the disk group is using offline initialization, or it's disks are down and data may be lost. - QTCR: Quarantined critical. The disk group is critical with at least one inaccessible disk. For example, two disks are inaccessible in a RAID 6 disk group or one disk is inaccessible for other fault-tolerant RAID levels. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined. - QTDN: Quarantined with a down disk. The RAID6 disk group has one inaccessible disk. The disk group is fault tolerant but degraded. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined. - QTOF: Quarantined offline. The disk group is offline with multiple inaccessible disks causing user data to be incomplete, or is an NRAID or RAID 0 disk group. - QTUN: Quarantined unsupported. The disk group contains data in a format that is not supported by this system. For example, this system does not support linear disk groups. - STOP: The disk group is stopped. - UNKN: Unknown. - UP: Up. The disk group is online and does not have fault-tolerant attributes.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group has damaged disks
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are damaged.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group has missing disks
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are missing.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is fault tolerant with a down disk
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are down.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is offline
trigger_prototype.description: Either the disk group is using offline initialization, or it's disks are down and data may be lost.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined critical
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is critical with at least one inaccessible disk. For example, two disks are inaccessible in a RAID 6 disk group or one disk is inaccessible for other fault-tolerant RAID levels. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined offline
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is offline with multiple inaccessible disks causing user data to be incomplete, or is an NRAID or RAID 0 disk group.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined unsupported
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group contains data in a format that is not supported by this system. For example, this system does not support linear disk groups.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined with an inaccessible disk
trigger_prototype.description: The RAID6 disk group has one inaccessible disk. The disk group is fault tolerant but degraded. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is stopped
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is stopped.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group status is critical
trigger_prototype.description: The disk group is online but isn't fault tolerant because some of its disks are down.

item_prototype.name: FRU [{#ENCLOSURE.ID}: {#LOCATION}]: Part number
item_prototype.description: {#DESCRIPTION}. Part number of the FRU.

item_prototype.name: FRU [{#ENCLOSURE.ID}: {#LOCATION}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: {#DESCRIPTION}. FRU serial number.

item_prototype.name: FRU [{#ENCLOSURE.ID}: {#LOCATION}]: Status
item_prototype.description:
{#DESCRIPTION}. FRU status:
Absent: Component is not present. Fault: At least one subcomponent has a fault. Invalid data: For a power supply module, the EEPROM is improperly programmed. OK: All subcomponents are operating normally. Not available: Status is not available.

trigger_prototype.name: FRU [{#ENCLOSURE.ID}: {#LOCATION}]: FRU ID data is invalid
trigger_prototype.description: The FRU ID data is invalid. The FRU's EEPROM is improperly programmed.

trigger_prototype.name: FRU [{#ENCLOSURE.ID}: {#LOCATION}]: FRU status is Degraded or Fault
trigger_prototype.description: FRU status is Degraded or Fault.
